name: 2-Methoxyethanol
Reason: 2-Methoxyethanol has a melting point of around -100 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces a hydroxyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, which can reduce the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius due to steric hindrance.
